author: Staff Reporter
text:
Awareness among workers and regular inspections by safety officers in factories on the implementation on safety measures are the important factors that will avoid industrial accidents, according to P. Bose, Director of Industrial Safety and Health (ISH) in Tamil Nadu.

Addressing the workers at Madura Coats Private Limited here on Saturday on account of the 45{+t}{+h}National Safety Day that fell on Friday, Mr. Bose said that the safety officers should act as role models in adherence to safety measures. He urged the workers not to be negligent and use appropriate safety gears while working.

Earlier, women employees enacted a drama to highlight the importance of implanting and following safety measures at workplace. The employees also took a pledge to adhere to safety procedures.

S. Rajamuthu, Joint Director of ISH, A. Seenivasan, Additional Director of ISH, P.K. Alexander, Industrial Relations Manager Madura Coats, G. Kumar, Manufacturing Manager, and P. Saravanakumar, Chief Safety Officer, also spoke in the function.
title: Regular inspections of factories by safety officers stressed
